subject: Communication
title: The DMIS: Stages of Cultural Sensitivity
description: A fast breakdown of The DMIS: Stages of Cultural Sensitivity for builders.

hook.text: Some people deny cultural differences exist. Others integrate them into their identity.

buildup.text: The Developmental Model of Intercultural Sensitivity has six stages: Denial, Defense, Minimization, Acceptance.

discovery.text: Most people are stuck at Minimization â€” 'We're all basically the same.' It feels inclusive but erases real differences.

twist.text: True cultural competence requires moving to Adaptation â€” adjusting your behavior and thinking based on cultural context.

climax.text: Integration, the final stage, means holding multiple cultural frames simultaneously â€” thinking and feeling in more.

punchline.text: Cultural sensitivity isn't a belief. It's a skill you develop in stages.
